episodes.description: Jon Jandai is a Thai organic farmer whose self-reliant way of living attracts people from around the world. He simplifies life with the question: "Life is easy, why make it difficult?"
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Andria Zafirakou, an art teacher in London, won the Global Teacher Prize 2018 and is using the prize money of $1 million to create a foundation to help provide arts to disadvantaged school children.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Kiko Matthews broke a world record when she rowed solo and unsupported across the Atlantic. It was just 6 months after having brain surgery for a rare illness. She raised thousands of pounds for the hospital that had saved her life.
episodes.description: Kiko Matthews from UK broke a world record when she rowed solo across the Atlantic, just 6 months after having brain surgery. She raised thousands of pounds for the hospital that had saved her life.
episodes.subtitle: Breaking a World Record: Kiko Matthews / World Record Ocean Rower
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Acclaimed Japan-China expert and Harvard Professor Emeritus Ezra Vogel discusses the history, cultural connection, and relationship between the 2 nations, and suggests how they can forge closer ties.
episodes.description: Acclaimed Japan-China expert and Harvard Professor Emeritus Ezra Vogel discussed the history, cultural connection and relationship between the 2 nations, and suggested how they can forge closer ties.
episodes.subtitle: Japan-China Relations, an Outsider's Perspective: Ezra Vogel / Sociologist
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Chinese lawyer Tang Shuai uses sign language to protect the legal rights of his clients who have hearing difficulties. He hopes for a law-abiding society that is more considerate to their needs.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Since founding The Voice of Libyan Women in 2011, doctor and women's rights advocate Alaa Murabit has challenged the global status quo with initiatives to put women in positions of leadership.
episodes.description: Since founding The Voice of Libyan Women in 2011, doctor and women's rights advocate Alaa Murabit has challenged the global status quo with initiatives to put women in positions of leadership.
episodes.subtitle: Raising the Voice of Women: Alaa Murabit / Women's Rights Advocate
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Professor at Harvard Graduate School of Education Todd Rose demystifies the century-old average-based systems in society and proposes design paradigms to embrace individuality and unique talents.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Madeline Stuart is a fashion model and entrepreneur with Down syndrome, traveling around the world with the support of her mother Rosanne. She breaks from conventional ways to open people's minds.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: We speak with the director of "Proyecto Hombre" - an NGO providing addiction treatment, mainly for drugs, to 17,000 people per year in Spain - on the true causes and solutions for this modern disease.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: In China, most visually impaired people become masseuses or masseurs, but the blind Dong Lina became a verbal artist. She presents her thoughts on the determination needed to overcome many obstacles.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Trinh Khanh Ha works on developing robotic prosthetic arms in Vietnam. With groundbreaking prosthetic arms, she gives hope to disabled people who gave up their work.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Delia Ferreira Rubio represents an international NGO that aims to eliminate crimes such as bribery and embezzlement worldwide. How can we prevent corruption, which she says undermines our daily lives?
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Kees Veldboer, the Ambulance Wish Foundation founder, has fulfilled over 13,000 final wishes of terminally ill patients. He reveals his thoughts about his contacts with dying people.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Robert Riener founded the Cybathlon, a global contest spurring the development of robotic assistive devices for people with disabilities. What role can robotics play in creating a diverse society?
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Bart Roetert, co-founder of Instock, a restaurant in the Netherlands, has rescued 800,000 kilograms of food waste. He tells how to address food waste issues in an efficient and positive manner.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: NORA is the lead vocalist of Orquesta de la Luz, a world-famous salsa band from Japan. She speaks about her passion for music, and what she hopes to accomplish through her work with the group.
episodes.description: NORA is the lead vocalist of Orquesta de la Luz, a world-famous salsa band from Japan. She speaks about her passion for music, and what she hopes to accomplish through her work with the group.
episodes.subtitle: No Salsa, No Life: NORA / Singer
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Open source technology advocate, Wikimedia Foundation CEO Katherine Maher encourages everyone to contribute and share knowledge and information on the free online encyclopedia, Wikipedia.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Sho Kitagawa plays the balalaika, a traditional Russian stringed musical instrument. He was the first person from outside Russia to win a prestigious Russian music competition.
episodes.description: Sho Kitagawa plays the balalaika, a traditional Russian stringed musical instrument. He was the first person from outside Russia to win a prestigious Russian music competition.
episodes.subtitle: A Three Generation Dream: Sho Kitagawa / Balalaika Player
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Noriaki Imai returned to Japan after a hostage ordeal in Iraq only to face harsh criticism, which made him a social recluse. Today, he supports young people who have similarly withdrawn from society.
episodes.description: Noriaki Imai returned to Japan after a hostage ordeal in Iraq only to face harsh criticism, which made him a social recluse. Today, he supports young people who have similarly withdrawn from society.
episodes.subtitle: Giving Young People Hope: Noriaki Imai / President, DxP
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Famous for its "Freak Cabaret" performances, the Ukrainian music and theater band Dakh Daughters sings about the harsh situation in Ukraine. Its vocalist explains the thoughts behind the lyrics.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Mitsuhiro Takasaki, President of Engineer Inc., developed innovative heavy-duty pliers that can remove stripped or rusted screws with ease. What is his manufacturing philosophy and business strategy?
episodes.description: Mitsuhiro Takasaki, President of Engineer Inc., developed innovative heavy-duty pliers that can remove stripped or rusted screws with ease. What is his manufacturing philosophy and business strategy?
episodes.subtitle: Removing Troublesome Screws: Mitsuhiro Takasaki / President, Engineer Inc.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Tomosuke Noda is the principal of the River School, a camp designed to teach kids how much fun rivers can be. He talks about the many outdoor activities the kids enjoy and his vision for the program.
episodes.description: Tomosuke Noda is the principal of the River School, a camp designed to teach kids how much fun rivers can be. He talks about the many outdoor activities the kids enjoy and his vision for the program.
episodes.subtitle: Raising River Kids: Tomosuke Noda / Nonfiction Writer & Canoeist
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Yoshihiko Akimoto developed canned bread that can be stockpiled for as long as 3 years. It is used as an emergency food and distributed as relief supplies to areas suffering from food shortages.
episodes.description: Yoshihiko Akimoto developed canned bread that can be stockpiled for as long as 3 years. It is used as an emergency food and distributed as relief supplies to areas suffering from food shortages.
episodes.subtitle: The Potential of Canned Bread: Yoshihiko Akimoto / President & CEO, Pan Akimoto
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Ziauddin Yousafzai is a teacher and activist who stood up to the Taliban in Pakistan. With his daughter Malala, he campaigns for girl's education and equality around the world.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Air pollution is causing health problems in Ulaanbaatar, the Mongolian capital. We speak with former Mongolian Minister of the Environment, Oyun Sanjaasuren, on its causes and solutions.
episodes.description: Air pollution is causing health problems in Ulaanbaatar, the Mongolian capital. We speak with former Mongolian Minister of the Environment, Oyun Sanjaasuren, on its causes and solutions.
episodes.subtitle: Tackling Air Pollution in Mongolia: Oyun Sanjaasuren / Director of Green Climate Fund
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Jokha Alharthi, the first Man Booker International Prize winner writing in Arabic, is also the first female Omani novelist translated into English. What message does her work have for today's world?
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: The Kobe Shu-Shin-Kan Breweries have been producing sake for over 260 years. We speak with president Takenosuke Yasufuku about how his firm makes sake with huge appeal both in Japan and worldwide.
episodes.description: The Kobe Shu-Shin-Kan Breweries have been producing sake for over 260 years. We speak with president Takenosuke Yasufuku about how his firm makes sake with huge appeal both in Japan and worldwide.
episodes.subtitle: Sake Goes Global: Takenosuke Yasufuku / President, Kobe Shu-Shin-Kan Breweries
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Tomohiko Izutsu was on a path to work in space science research, but he changed course, and is now dedicated to revitalizing rural communities through space-themed events. What drives his mission?
episodes.description: Tomohiko Izutsu was on a path to work in space science research, but he changed course, and is now dedicated to revitalizing rural communities through space-themed events. What drives his mission?
episodes.subtitle: Space-Themed Community Revitalization: Tomohiko Izutsu / Community Revitalization Specialist
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Apichatpong Weerasethakul directed "Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives," winning at Cannes in 2010. He connects memories of oneself with society and politics, and is now focusing on Colombia.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Myanmar in southeast Asia suffers from a lack of safe drinking water. Hisafumi Shogi works with locals to develop the water supply infrastructure. He talks about the road so far and what lies ahead.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Koichiro Kobayashi has won gold at the Paraclimbing World Championships four times in a row. He works to help people who are visually impaired take up climbing. What does the sport mean to him?
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Houriya Taheri, the Middle East's first FIFA A-licensed women's soccer coach, speaks on what women athletes in the region, whose participation has been limited, need to help them spread their wings.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Albert Lin is an award-winning explorer and scientist from California who is innovating technology to uncover hidden stories of history from lost civilizations and ancient ruins all over the world.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Terumo is a Japanese manufacturer of medical devices such as catheter-based solutions for the treatment of coronary arteries. Company CEO Sato Shinjiro talks about reducing the burden on patients.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Takeuchi Masahiko runs and funds a nonprofit that builds schools for the blind around the world. Takeuchi himself is visually impaired. We speak with him about his life's work.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Bartender Gokan Shingo was named 2017 International Bartender of the Year. He talks about the secrets behind his signature cocktails and what he loves about bar culture.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: For many foreigners living in Japan, the language barrier is hard to overcome. Choi Sungja is an advisor at a cafe where foreigners become chefs, communicating with Japan through their native cuisine.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Director Iwaisawa Kenji won the top prize at the Ottawa International Animation Festival for his 2019 feature film. He talks about his hand-drawn approach and what he hopes to convey through his work.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Yoshitake Shinsuke is one of Japan's best known children's book authors, the winner of multiple international prizes. He finds inspiration in aspects of kids' lives that grown-ups tend to ignore.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Hagiuda Megumi imports and sells African roses from Kenya as part of an effort to contribute to women's employment in the region. She talks about what roses mean to her, and what drives her.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Bernd Gaiser, a co-founder of Berlin CSD, talks about why he encourages coming out of the closet and how he came to set up a multi-generational housing project for those of any sexual orientation.
episodes.description: Bernd Gaiser, a co-founder of Berlin CSD, talks about why he encourages coming out of the closet and how he came to set up a multi-generational housing project for those of any sexual orientation.
episodes.subtitle: Taking Action Makes a Difference: Bernd Gaiser / Activist of the Lesbian and Gay Movement
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Extreme weather around the world is causing an increase in major natural disasters. We ask Ishii Mieko, a nurse who has worked in several disaster zones, about how to save lives.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Richard H. Kaszynski formed a global network to rapidly conduct clinical drug trials in order to fight against infectious disease pandemics. He talks about a promising drug candidate for COVID-19.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: When the COVID-19 pandemic hit Malaysia, Rashvin Singh and his team at his social enterprise wanted to make a difference and began producing face shields to help frontliners.
episodes.description: When the Covid-19 pandemic hit Malaysia, Rashvin Singh and his team at his social enterprise wanted to make a difference and began producing face shields to help frontliners.
episodes.subtitle: Making a Difference: Rashvin Singh / Co-Founder of Biji-Biji Initiative
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Minister Audrey Tang's IT measures against COVID-19 greatly contributed to Taiwan's successful containment of the virus. She is also a leading force behind Taiwan's digital democracy.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Fashion designer Morinaga Kunihiko creates technologically innovative styles that no one has ever seen before. He tells us what motivates his work, and discusses the untapped potential of clothing.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Social entrepreneur Nakamoto Chizu started up a brand that makes colorful bags out of African fabrics. She talks about her vision of providing stable employment to Uganda's single mothers.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: As the coronavirus strikes the world, South Korea's corona prevention measures are recognized as a success. Professor Ki Moran, the chief of COVID-19 task force is leading the success with the government.
episodes.description: As the coronavirus strikes the world, South Korea's corona prevention measures are recognized as a success. Professor Moran Ki, the chief of COVID-19 task force is leading the success with government.
episodes.subtitle: The Story Behind COVID-19 Measures: Ki Moran / Professor, Department of Cancer Control and Population Health at the National Cancer Center
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Taavi Kotka of Estonia, an IT powerhouse with 99% of its government services available online, speaks on how engineering will shape our technological future.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Khaled Reshad's day job is running a local medical clinic in Japan, but he also works to build hospitals and schools in his home country of Afghanistan. We speak with Dr. Reshad about his work.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Yamami Koji creates award - winning kaleidoscopes that rise to the level of art. What sort of wizardry goes into crafting optical instruments that surprise and delight the eyes?
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Yamasaki Nobuyoshi's company produces items like food trays and garbage bags using a sustainable limestone-based material. He talks about its potential as an alternative to paper or plastic.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Pastor Okuda Tomoshi has been working with homeless people for over 30 years, helping 3,500 get back on their feet. He talks about what is necessary to create a society where no one is left ignored.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Illustrations by Estonian artist Eiko Ojala have appeared in newspapers and magazines worldwide. His gorgeous paper-like graphic designs shine a penetrating light on modern society.
episodes.description: Illustrations by Estonian artist Eiko Ojala have appeared in newspapers and magazines worldwide. His gorgeous paper-like graphic designs shine a penetrating light on modern society.
episodes.subtitle: Quiet Art Speaks Strongly: Eiko Ojala / Illustrator
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Nakajima Satoshi is a software engineer developing a free app for takeout orders that he designed to help businesses pushed to the verge of bankruptcy by the economic effects of the COVID-19 outbreak.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Dominique Chen, known for his outstanding research in the field of information studies, talks about ways to achieve well-being through digital communications.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Earth Heir, a social enterprise in Malaysia is founded by Sasibai Kimis to empower the lives of marginalized communities, emphasizing on combining traditional craftsmanship with modern design.
episodes.description: Earth Heir, a social enterprise in Malaysia is founded by Sasibai Kimis to empower the lives of marginalized communities, emphasizing on combining traditional craftsmanship with modern design.
episodes.subtitle: Changing Perceptions: Sasibai Kimis / Founder of Earth Heir
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: With amazing economic growth in recent years, Rwanda has been pursuing a progressive ICT policy. The woman appointed Minister of ICT and Innovation at merely 35 talks about the future ICT offers.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Saengduean Chailert, the founder of Elephant Nature Park in northern Thailand, has devoted her life to caring for Asian elephants that were wounded while made to work as performance animals or in logging.
episodes.description: Saengduean Chailert, founder of Elephant Nature Park in northern Thailand, has devoted her life to caring for Asian elephants that were wounded while made to work as performance animals or in logging.
episodes.subtitle: All Life on Earth Is Equal: Saengduean Chailert / Founder of Save Elephant Foundation, Director of Elephant Nature Park
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Anoushka Shankar is a sitarist, composer and producer who has won many awards in the world music scene. She is the daughter of Indian musician Ravi Shankar. She is also a social activist and feminist.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.description: Perrine & Charles Herve-Gruyer, Proprietors in France, have quested for tomorrow's agriculture that reconstructs ecosystems, inspired by methods of ancient civilizations and latest scientific studies.
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Max Richter is one of the most successful composers in the contemporary music world. He has produced critically acclaimed albums of his own compositions, and also writes for films, ballet and opera.
episodes.description: Max Richter is one of the most successful composers in the contemporary music world. He has produced critically acclaimed albums of his own compositions, and also writes for films, ballet, and opera.
episodes.subtitle: Communicating With Music: Max Richter / Composer
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Endo Ken is developing next-generation artificial limbs, including the world's best sports prosthetic and a robotic leg that reduces strain for those with disabilities. What is his vision for society?
episodes.description: Endo Ken is developing next-generation artificial limbs, including the world's best sports prosthetic and a robotic leg that reduces strain for those with disabilities. What is his vision for society?
episodes.subtitle: Giving the Joy of Running: Endo Ken / Prosthetic Leg Engineer
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Director Ladj Ly's film "Les Misrables" was a Jury Prize winner in Cannes Film Festival 2019. He tells us how we can overcome racism and poverty as BLM expands in France.
episodes.description: Director Ladj Ly's film "Les Miserables" was a Jury Prize winner in Cannes Film Festival 2019. He tells us how we can overcome racism and poverty as BLM expands in France.
episodes.subtitle: The Real "Les Misrables" of Today: Ladj Ly / Film Director
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Lee Ayu Chuepa, founder of Akha Ama Coffee and a member of Thailand's Akha ethnic minority, provides high-quality coffee to global consumers while protecting the livelihood of his community's farmers.
episodes.description: Lee Ayu Chuepa, founder of Akha Ama Coffee and a member of Thailand's Akha ethnic minority, provides high-quality coffee to global consumers while protecting the livelihood of his community's farmers.
episodes.subtitle: Enriching People's Lives With Coffee: Lee Ayu Chuepa / Founder of Akha Ama Coffee, Social Entrepreneur
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: HARA is an illusionist who has performed live and on television in over 30 countries, winning numerous awards. We speak with him about how he strives to conjure up "magic that only I can do."
episodes.description: HARA is an illusionist who has performed live and on television in over 30 countries, winning numerous awards. We speak with him about how he strives to conjure up "magic that only I can do."
episodes.subtitle: Original Magic That Captivates the World: HARA / Illusionist
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Graphic designer Shimada Tamotsu was chosen to design the official logo for the 2025 World Exposition to be held in Osaka Prefecture, Japan. What is the concept behind the eye-catching design?
episodes.description: Graphic designer Shimada Tamotsu was chosen to design the official logo for the 2025 World Exposition to be held in Osaka, Japan. What is the concept behind the eye-catching design?
episodes.subtitle: Behind the Logo: Shimada Tamotsu / Graphic Designer
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Londoner, Josie Naughton co-founded Help Refugees, a charity devoted to raising funds to help refugees and displaced people who are escaping war, persecution and poverty.
episodes.description: Londoner, Josie Naughton co-founded Help Refugees, a charity devoted to raising funds to help refugees and displaced people who are escaping war, persecution and poverty.
episodes.subtitle: The Forgotten Refugees: Josie Naughton / Co-founder & CEO Help Refugees
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Lilian Thuram, a former football star who contributed to the victory of France in FIFA World Cup 1998, has fought with his foundation against racism through books, exhibitions and workshops since 2008.
episodes.description: Lilian Thuram, former football star who contributed the victory of France in FIFA World Cup 1998, has fought with his foundation against racism through books, exhibitions and workshops since 2008.
episodes.subtitle: Freeing the World of Racism: Lilian Thuram / Anti-Discrimination Advocate
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Producer of hit musicals discusses how Broadway theaters should reopen safely and profitably in the COVID-19 era and respond to the Black Lives Matter movement by appealing to a more diverse audience.
episodes.description: Producer of hit musicals discusses how Broadway theaters should reopen safely and profitably in the COVID-19 era and respond to the Black Lives Matter movement by appealing to a more diverse audience.
episodes.subtitle: Bringing the Lights Back to Broadway: Yasuhiro Kawana / Theater Producer
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Stella Jean has submitted action plans to the council to eliminate discrimination in the Italian fashion industry. In particular, she is struggling to give non-white youth a chance to get jobs.
episodes.description: Stella Jean has submitted action plans to the council to eliminate discrimination in the Italian fashion industry. In particular, she is struggling to give non-white youth a chance to get jobs.
episodes.subtitle: Building Bridges to Diversity: Stella Jean / Fashion Designer
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: The bicycles painstakingly crafted by Konno Shinichi offer superior technology and design. Japanese cyclists love them, and they've won multiple awards at international trade shows.
episodes.description: The bicycles painstakingly crafted by Konno Shinichi offer superior technology and design. Japanese cyclists love them, and they've won multiple awards at international trade shows.
episodes.subtitle: Ideal Framing: Konno Shinichi / Bicycle Framebuilder
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Purintei Merin performs Rakugo, a type of storytelling that has a more than 400-year history. She writes and delivers original pieces in both Japanese and English. Hear her story.
episodes.description: Purintei Merin performs rakugo, a type of storytelling that has a more than 400-year history. She writes and delivers original pieces in both Japanese and English. Hear her story.
episodes.subtitle: A New Style of Sit-Down Comedy: Purintei Merin / Rakugo Storyteller
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: For former astronaut Chris Hadfield, life in self-isolation amid the pandemic is similar to that of an astronaut in space. He shares his tips on how to survive and thrive in the long-running pandemic.
episodes.description: For former astronaut Chris Hadfield, life in self-isolation amid the pandemic is similar to that of an astronaut in space. He shares his tips on how to survive and thrive in the long-running pandemic.
episodes.subtitle: Command Your Spaceship in Isolation: Chris Hadfield / Former Astronaut
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: In 2017, Fujiki Daichi became the first Asian countertenor to debut at the Vienna State Opera. What does he wish to convey to audiences through his dazzling performances?
episodes.description: In 2017, Fujiki Daichi became the first Asian countertenor to debut at the Vienna State Opera. What does he wish to convey to audiences through his dazzling performances?
episodes.subtitle: Reaching Operatic Heights: Fujiki Daichi / Countertenor
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Sociology professor James Nolan warns of the danger to society of an unchecked technological mindset. His new book explores the complicity of doctors in covering up the dangers of the atom bomb.
episodes.description: Sociology professor James Nolan warns of the danger to society of an unchecked technological mindset.  His new book explores the complicity of doctors in covering up the dangers of the atom bomb.
episodes.subtitle: Technology's Power to Shape Us: James Nolan / Professor of Sociology
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Kogenji Ryota is a world champion pole dancer who was named Mr. Pole Dance 2020. How does he come up with his routines, for which audiences have described him as being like a floating white fairy?
episodes.description: Kogenji Ryota is a world champion pole dancer who was named Mr. Pole Dance 2020. How does he come up with his routines, for which audiences have described him as being like a floating white fairy?
episodes.subtitle: A Perch to Be Myself: Kogenji Ryota / Pole Dancer
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Dr. Claire Wardle is on a mission to help the global public understand the dangers of disinformation and misinformation, which have proliferated with the rise of social media and now the coronavirus.
episodes.description: Dr. Claire Wardle is on a mission to help the global public understand the dangers of disinformation and misinformation, which have proliferated with the rise of social media and now the coronavirus.
episodes.subtitle: The Fight Against Misinformation: Claire Wardle / Social Media Expert
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Yukari Suzuki has been working for reconciliation between the Dutch, Japanese and Indonesian. How can people transcend division through dialogue?
episodes.description: Yukari Suzuki has been working for reconciliation between the Dutch, Japanese and Indonesian. How can people transcend division through dialogue?
episodes.subtitle: Bridging the Division: Yukari Tangena Suzuki / Chairperson "The Foundation Dialogue Netherlands-Japan-Indonesia"
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Nodoka Okisawa is one of the world's most buzzed-about young conductors. In 2019 she won the prestigious International Besanon Competition. We speak to her about her musical passions.
episodes.description: Nodoka Okisawa is one of the world's most buzzed-about young conductors. In 2019 she won the prestigious International Besancon Competition. We speak to her about her musical passions.
episodes.subtitle: Musical Direction: Nodoka Okisawa / Conductor
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Nishimura Satoshi is developing an original electric car concept, as well as a microscope that can perform high-res imaging of living organisms. He talks about the philosophy of making things.
episodes.description: Nishimura Satoshi is developing an original electric car concept, as well as a microscope that can perform high-res imaging of living organisms. He talks about the philosophy of making things.
episodes.subtitle: Making Things That Enrich Lives: Nishimura Satoshi / Professor, Jichi Medical University
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Mounir Biba, multiple world champion of Breaking, runs the project about breaking and coaching to support young people. He also contributed to the promotion of Breaking for Olympic sports inclusion.
episodes.description: Mounir Biba, multiple world champion of Breaking, runs the project about breaking and coaching to support young people. He contributed also to the promotion of Breaking for Olympic sports inclusion.
episodes.subtitle: Breaking Makes Everything Possible: Mounir Biba / Breaker/Motivational Coach
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Wendy Kopp heads "Teach For All." It recruits recent graduates to teach for a 2-year mission. It operates in 59 countries providing quality education in challenging places and even during COVID-19.
episodes.description: Wendy Kopp heads "Teach For All." It recruits recent graduates to teach for a 2-year mission. It operates in 59 countries providing quality education in challenging places and even during COVID-19.
episodes.subtitle: Quality Education Around the World: Wendy Kopp / CEO and Co-Founder of Teach For All
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Fashion designer Agns b, who has long supported artists and continued various social activities, recently opened new art gallery in Paris. She talks about the power of art in society.
episodes.description: Fashion designer Agnes b, who has long supported artists and continued various social activities, recently opened new art gallery in Paris. She talks about the power of art in society.
episodes.subtitle: Embracing a Passion for Art and Beauty: Agns b. / Fashion Designer
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: In civil war-torn Uganda, over 30,000 children were abducted and forced to serve as fighters. Follow Ogawa Shingo's quest to reintegrate former child soldiers into society through vocational training.
episodes.description: In civil war-torn Uganda, over 30,000 children were abducted and forced to serve as fighters. Follow Ogawa Shingo's quest to reintegrate former child soldiers into society through vocational training.
episodes.subtitle: Believing in the Strength of the African People: Ogawa Shingo / Director of NGO Supporting Social Reintegration of Child Soldiers
episodes.title: Direct Talk

episodes.content: Thai restaurant owner/chef Phanuphon Bulsuwan uses a wide array of local ingredients for his dishes. He is also taking steps to combat food waste, both in his own kitchen and society at large.
episodes.description: Thai restaurant owner/chef Phanuphon Bulsuwan uses a wide array of local ingredients for his dishes. He is also taking steps to combat food waste, both in his own kitchen and society at large.
episodes.subtitle: Delicious Dishes, Zero Waste: Phanuphon Bulsuwan / Owner/Chef, Blackitch Artisan Kitchen
episodes.title: Direct Talk
